Introduction.Name: Daemons of Chaos
Introduction.Annotation: The Daemons of Chaos, known also as the Legions of Chaos, the Arch-Enemy, the Great Beast, or simply just Daemons (not to be confused with other kinds of daemons) are malevolent, otherwordly entities born from the deepest and darkest emotions of all mortal creatures. From their fortresses and palaces within this Realm of Chaos, these entities watch with envious eyes towards the mortal kingdoms, waiting with unblinking patience for their chance to wreak destruction and dismay upon the world and to feed upon the misery that they have wrought.\n\nOf the many forces which permeate the world, both emotional and natural otherwise, there are but only Four which holds supreme power within this plane of unnatural existence. Power/Anger, Lust/Pleasure, Death/Despair and Change/Hope are the four greatest forces which have enthralled the world in its grip, for in a world engulfed in such amounts of war, corruption and disease, their dark presence and their malign influence is all but inevitable, for these dark emotions and thoughts fuel the main four Gods of Chaos, Khorne the Blood God, Slaanesh the Dark Prince, Nurgle the Plaguefather and Tzeentch the Changer of Ways.

Special.SpecialRule: While Skarbrand is alive, all units on the table (friendly and enemy) are subject to the rules for hatred

May choose any four spells from the Lores of Life, Metal, Light and Heavens and four spells from the Lores of Death, Beasts, Shadow and Fire; both always know all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Tzeentch
The Daemon may re-roll a single D6 once per player turn
Can never be wounded on better than a 3+
Roll a D6 at the start of each Magic phase: on the roll of a 2-6 you may immediately increase, by one base, the size of one Nurgling unit within 6"
Enemy units do not receive combat resolution bonuses for attacking the flank or rear of a Daemon or any unit he has joined
Necrotic Missiles with range 24", wounds on 2+ and no armour saves

Option.Name: Daemonic Robes
Option.SpecialRule: Can never be wounded on better than a 3+

Option.Name: Enrapturing Gaze
Option.SpecialRule: Models in base contact may not use another model's Leadership value

Option.Name: Iridescent Corona
Option.SpecialRule: Enemy models in base contact at start of any combat suffer a Flaming Strength 3 hit before any blows are struck

Option.Name: Winged Horror
Option.SpecialRule: Fly

Option.Name: Dark Insanity
Option.SpecialRule: 2D6+2 Attacks, roll at the start of each combat

Option.Name: Obsidian Armour
Option.SpecialRule: Magic weapons carriad by enemy models lose their magical abilities in base contact

Option.Name: Firestorm Blade
Option.SpecialRule: Flaming Attacks

Option.Name: Spell Breaker
Option.SpecialRule: Once per battle may automatically dispel one enemy spell

Option.Name: Collar of Khorne
Option.SpecialRule: Magic Resistance(3)

Option.Name: Twin Heads
Option.SpecialRule: +2 to all casting rolls

Option.Name: Tzeentch's Will
Option.SpecialRule: May re-roll a single D6 once per player turn

Option.Name: Spell Destroyer
Option.SpecialRule: Once per battle may automatically dispel one enemy spell, the spell is lost on the roll of a 4+

Option.Name: Dark Magister
Option.SpecialRule: Ignores the result of his first miscast

Option.Name: Daemonic Robes
Option.SpecialRule: Can never be wounded on better than a 3+

Option.Name: Flames of Tzeentch
Option.SpecialRule: D6 bolts in the Shooting phase with a range of 18" and a Strength of 4

Option.Name: Iridescent Corona
Option.SpecialRule: Enemy models in base contact at start of any combat suffer a Flaming Strength 3 hit before any blows are struck

Option.Name: Master of Sorcery
Option.SpecialRule: Can use any of the Lores of Magic, it knows all the spells from whichever Lore it chooses

Special.SpecialRule: Knows all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Tzeentch

Option.Name: Nurglings Infestation
Option.SpecialRule: Roll a D6 at the start of each Magic phase, on 2+ it may immediately increase, by one base, the size of one Nurgling unit within 6"

Option.Name: Staff of Nurgle
Option.SpecialRule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Rancid Visitation

Option.Name: Noxious Vapours
Option.SpecialRule: All enemies models in base contact lose the Always Strikes First rule and always strike last

Option.Name: Pestilent Mucus
Option.SpecialRule: When Daemon suffers a wound, all enemy models in base contact must pass a Toughness test for each wound inflicted of themselves suffer a wound, with no armour saves allowed

Option.Name: Nurgle's Rot
Option.SpecialRule: Enemy model in base contact at the start of any Magic phase suffer a wound on the roll of a 6, with no Armour Saves allowed

Option.Name: Stream of Bile
Option.SpecialRule: Strength 4 breath weapon

Option.Name: Slime Trail
Option.SpecialRule: Enemy inits do not receive combat result bonuses for attacking the flank or rear

Special.SpecialRule: Knows all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Nurgle

Option.Name: Spirit Swallower
Option.SpecialRule: Gains one wound for each unsaved wound it causes in close combat

Option.Name: Temptator
Option.SpecialRule: At the beginning of a combat, one enemy character in base contact must take a Leadership test, if the test is failed, the character will direct his attacks against friendly models or units chosen by Daemon's controlling player

Option.Name: Daemonic Robes
Option.SpecialRule: Can never be wounded on better than a 3+

Option.Name: Enrapturing Gaze
Option.SpecialRule: Models in base contact may not use another model's Leadership value

Option.Name: Siren Song
Option.SpecialRule: Once per game, before charges are declared, nominate one enemy within 20": the target unit must either declare a charge against the Daemon (or the unit it is with) or immediately flee, exactly as if it had failed a Panic test

Option.Name: Soporific Musk
Option.SpecialRule: A unit in base contact rolls an extra dice when fleeing and then discards the highest result

Special.SpecialRule: Knows all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Slaanesh

Hero.Name: Skulltaker
Hero.Description: Khorne's Champion, Blooded Wanderer, Slayer of Kings

Special.SpecialRule: Must always issue a challenge, of accept a challenge if one is offered

Hero.Name: The Blue Scribes of Tzeentch
Hero.Description: Azure Arcanologists, Wandering Wizardkin, Tzeentch's Quaestors

Hero.Name: Epidemius
Hero.Description: Tallyman of Nurgle, The Maggot King

Hero.Name: The Masque of Slaanesh
Hero.Description: Eternal Dancer, Accursed Maiden, Darkling Deceiver

Option.Name: Obsidian Armour
Option.SpecialRule: Magic weapons carriad by enemy models lose their magical abilities in base contact

Option.SpecialRule: Can never be wounded on better than a 3+

Option.Name: Firestorm Blade
Option.SpecialRule: Flaming Attacks

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.SpecialRule: BSB

Option.Name: Standard of Chaos Glory
Option.SpecialRule: All Daemons within 12" are stubborn

Option.Name: Banner of Hellfire
Option.SpecialRule: Bound spell, Power level 5: D6 Strength 6 hits on every enemy unit within 12" - even those that are in combat

Option.Name: Great Icon of Despair
Option.SpecialRule: All enemy units within 12" suffer a -2 penalty to their Leadership

Option.Name: Great Standard of Sundering
Option.SpecialRule: All Wizards suffer a -2 penalty to cast spells from that Lore, any spells cast from the Lore of Light will miscast on the roll of a double 1, 2 or 3

Special.SpecialRule: A unit of Horrors can cast Spells from the Daemon Lore of Tzeentch

Option.Name: Changeling
Option.SpecialRule: Formless Horror

Option.Name: Banner of Change
Option.SpecialRule: Bound Spell, Power Level 3: inflicts 3D6 Strength 3 hits on one enemy unit in base contact

Option.Name: Icon of Sorcery
Option.SpecialRule: +1 bonus for casting spells

Option.Name: Icon of Eternal Virulence
Option.SpecialRule: Each unsaved wound caused by this unit's Poisoned Attacks rule adds an extra point of Combat Resolution

Option.Name: Siren Standard
Option.SpecialRule: Any enemy unit charged may only choose hold as a charge reaction, they may not stand and shoot or voluntarily flee
